titleStmt.title: T. W. Campbell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4536

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Madisonville January 9th 1864
To His Excellency The Govener of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Hopkins County would respectfully ask your Excellency to remit a fine of $250 -- in so much therefo as is in your power to remit against George W Simons of this County. Said Simons Some time in year 1860 Shot at and Wounded one W R Vaughan of this place Simons was endicted at the next term of our circuit ^Court^ for the offence in the fall of 1861. Simons Joined the 25th Regiment Ky Volunters under (Col J M Shackelford) and fought bravely through Several hard contested Battles among the number was Donnelson & Shiloh and when Genl Buels army came to Louisville was taken sick & left in Hospital & while there was discharged on account of disability came home appeared before the Court when his name was called & was tried & fined the sum of $250 -- we woud ask that this fine or So much as you can remit be remitted for which favor we will ever feel grateful we remain your friends verry Respectfully

T. W. Campbell
J B Frost by T. W. Campbell
W, E, W, Rhea
Joshua Wingo, by W. E. W. Rhea
Asez. Gibson by. W, E, W, Rhea
W. B. Smith
